### üå± Example 1. Agricultural Experiment ‚Äî Effect of Growth Regulators on *In Vitro* Plantlets

Researchers aim to assess how different plant growth regulators (PGRs) influence 
the elongation of tomato plantlets grown *in vitro*.

- **Experimental units:** 45 tomato plantlets cultured in identical sterile glass tubes 
  with the same growth medium and light conditions.  
- **Treatments (Factor):** 3 PGR formulations:  
  a. Auxin-dominant (IAA-based)  
  b. Cytokinin-dominant (BAP-based)  
  c. Balanced auxin‚Äìcytokinin mixture  
- **Design:** Each plantlet is randomly assigned to one of the three treatments (15 per group).  
- **Response variable:** Mean shoot length (cm) after 4 weeks.

<p style="text-align:center;"><em>Because all tubes are identical and conditions uniform, randomization alone ensures unbiased comparison ‚Äî a classic Completely Randomized Design.</em></p>

### üêÅ Example 2. Biomedical Experiment ‚Äî Analgesic Doses in Genetically Identical Mice

A pharmacology lab evaluates the effect of different doses of a new analgesic on the pain threshold of laboratory mice.

- **Experimental units:** 40 male mice of the same inbred strain, all 10 weeks old, maintained under identical housing, feeding, and lighting conditions.  
- **Treatments (Factor):** 4 doses of the analgesic:  
  a. 0 mg/kg (control)  
  b. 2 mg/kg  
  c. 5 mg/kg  
  d. 10 mg/kg  
- **Design:** Each mouse is randomly assigned to one of the four doses (10 per treatment).  
- **Response variable:** Pain response latency (seconds) measured in a hot-plate test after drug administration.

<p style="text-align:center;"><em>Since the mice are genetically and environmentally homogeneous, no blocking is required ‚Äî randomization alone provides a valid CRD structure.</em></p>

### ‚úÖ Summary

| Example | Field | Experimental Unit | Treatments | Response Variable |
|:--------|:------|:-----------------|:------------|:------------------|
| 1 | Agriculture | Tomato plantlets | 3 PGR formulations | Shoot length (cm) |
| 2 | Biomedicine | Mice (inbred strain) | 4 analgesic doses | Pain latency (s) |

<p style='text-align:center;'><em>Both studies use homogeneous experimental units and random assignment of treatments ‚Äî 
the defining features of a Completely Randomized Design.</em></p>
